options.text: Widespread public outrage and attacks on government symbols
The formation of the Muslim League

questions.answer: Widespread public outrage and attacks on government symbols

questions.question: The underground movement was joined by leaders like ______.
The 'Patri Sarkar' in Satara put an end to which social evil?
Subhash Chandra Bose fled from India in 1941 to which country first?
The Indian National Army successfully reached the border of India and captured which state's territory in 1944?
Where did the Air Force personnel revolt in 1946?
Who established the Toofan Sena?
Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose died in a plane crash in August ______.
The Quit India Movement proved that the British rule was no longer ______.
Who was the Viceroy of India when the Quit India Movement was launched?
What did the Cabinet ministers of the Indian National Congress do after coming to power in 1937?
questions.answer: They released political prisoners, introduced basic education, prohibited liquor, improved conditions for Dalits, and passed debt relief acts for farmers.

questions.question: Why was the Cripps Mission sent to India in 1942?
questions.answer: Because Britain needed Indian cooperation during WWII as Japan approached India's eastern borders.

questions.question: Why did the Indian National Congress reject the Cripps Mission proposal?
questions.answer: It did not clearly mention complete independence for India.

questions.question: Why did the Muslim League reject the Cripps Mission?
questions.answer: It did not mention the creation of Pakistan.

questions.question: When did the Second World War begin?
What did the Indian National Congress demand from England at the start of WWII?
Why did the Indian National Congress ministers resign in November 1939?
questions.answer: Because England refused to grant India independence during WWII.

questions.question: Where was the Quit India Resolution passed by the Congress Working Committee in July 1942?
Where was the Indian National Congress session held to approve the Quit India Resolution in August 1942?
Who was the President of the Indian National Congress session in August 1942?
What was Mahatma Gandhi's famous call during the Quit India Movement?
How did the public react to the arrest of Congress leaders in 1942?
questions.answer: With angry processions and attacks on jails, police stations, and railway stations.

questions.question: Name one place in Maharashtra where people struggled during the Quit India Movement.
Who led the school children's procession at Nandurbar?
What happened to Shirishkumar and other children at Nandurbar?
questions.answer: They were martyred when police opened fire.

questions.question: What is the term for the movement led by young socialists after 1942?
Name two leaders of the Underground Movement.
questions.answer: Jayprakash Narayan and Aruna Asaf Ali.

questions.question: How did underground activists disrupt British administration?
questions.answer: By breaking railway routes, cutting telephone lines, and blowing up bridges.

questions.question: Who was the first satyagrahi of the Individual Satyagraha?
What was the purpose of Individual Satyagraha?
questions.answer: Anti-war propaganda through individual disobedience of laws.

questions.question: Who was Hemu Kalani and what did he do?
questions.answer: A patriot in Sindh who tried to destroy a railway carrying British troops; he was hanged.

questions.question: What was the name of Bhai Kotwal's group in Karjat?
Who established the secret 'Azad Radio' in Mumbai?
What was broadcast on Azad Radio?
questions.answer: Patriotic songs, news of agitations, and speeches.

questions.question: What is a Parallel Government?
questions.answer: A 'People's Government' established by driving out British officers in some areas.

questions.question: Name one district in Maharashtra where a Parallel Government was established.
Who established the Parallel Government in Satara?
What was the name of the army formed under Krantigarani G. D. (Bapu Lad)?
What constructive work did the Parallel Government in Satara do?
questions.answer: Opposed moneylenders, prohibited liquor, spread literacy, and fought caste distinctions.

questions.question: What is another name for the Quit India Movement?
Who composed patriotic songs that inspired the Quit India agitators?
questions.answer: Sane Guruji and Rashtrasant Tukdoji Maharaj.

questions.question: What was the full name of the Indian National Army?
Who was the supreme leader of the Indian National Army?
Why did Subhash Chandra Bose resign as Congress President?
questions.answer: Due to differences with other senior leaders over seeking help from Britain's enemies during WWII.

questions.question: Which party did Subhash Chandra Bose found after leaving Congress?
How did Subhash Chandra Bose escape house arrest?
Which country did Subhash Chandra Bose reach in April 1941?
What did Subhash Chandra Bose establish in Germany?
Who invited Subhash Chandra Bose to Japan?
Who formed the first battalion of the Indian National Army?
questions.answer: Rash Behari Bose with Captain Mohan Singh.

questions.question: From which group was the initial INA formed?
questions.answer: Indian Prisoners of War captured by Japan.

questions.question: Where did Netaji establish the Azad Hind Government?
Name one chief associate of Netaji in the Azad Hind Government.
Who was the Commander of the Rani of Jhansi Regiment?
What was Netaji's famous slogan?
questions.answer: You give me blood and I will give you independence.

questions.question: What did Japan hand over to the Azad Hind Government in November 1943?
What new names did Netaji give to Andaman and Nicobar?
Which province in Myanmar did the INA capture in 1944?
Why did the Imphal campaign remain incomplete?
questions.answer: Because Japan stopped helping the Indian National Army.

questions.question: When and how did Subhash Chandra Bose die?
questions.answer: On 18 August 1945 in a plane accident.

questions.question: Who defended the INA officers in the British trial?
questions.answer: Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, Bhulabhai Desai, and Tej Bahadur Sapre.

questions.question: What was the initial verdict against the INA officers?
What did the British Government finally do to the INA officers' sentences?
Where did the 1946 revolt of the Indian Navy begin?
questions.answer: On the British warship 'Talwar' in Mumbai.

questions.question: What did the naval rebels do on the warship 'Talwar'?
questions.answer: Unfurled the tricolor flag and raised slogans against the British.

questions.question: Who mediated to end the 1946 Naval Revolt?
How did the Indian Air Force show support for the Naval Revolt?
questions.answer: Officers in Delhi, Lahore, Karachi, Ambala, and Meerut went on strike.

questions.question: What did the revolts of 1942-1946 indicate about British rule?
questions.answer: They shook the foundation of British power in India.

questions.question: Why did the British realize they could not rule India for long after 1946?
questions.answer: Because even the Army, Navy, and Air Force were now opposing them.

questions.question: Who was the first individual satyagrahi?
What is another name for the 1942 movement?
Which islands did Japan conquer and hand over to the Azad Hind Government in 1943?
What was the organization founded by Subhash Chandra Bose called?
Who founded the Indian Independence League?
Who founded the Toofan Sena?
questions.answer: Krantigarani G. D. alias Bapu Lad

questions.question: Which Viceroy declared India's entry into WWII without consulting Indians?
What was the main demand of the Quit India Resolution?
questions.answer: Immediate end of British rule in India

questions.question: Who moved the 'Quit India' resolution in the Mumbai session?
Which three provinces in 1937 did not give a clear majority to any party?
questions.answer: They formed mixed cabinets (provinces: Bengal, Punjab, Sindh)

questions.question: What was the reaction of the British government to the Quit India Movement's start?
questions.answer: Arrested all major Congress leaders immediately

questions.question: What was the secret radio station operated by Usha Mehta called?
What was the main goal of the Indian Independence League?
questions.answer: To organize Indian patriots in Southeast Asia for India's freedom

questions.question: What was the role of 'Azad Dasta' in Karjat?
questions.answer: To make the British government helpless through guerrilla actions

questions.question: What was the 'Lal Sena' in Nagpur?
questions.answer: A revolutionary group led by General Awari opposing British rule

questions.question: What kind of government was formed in Midnapore, Ballia, and Satara?
What was the main activity of the People's Courts in Parallel Governments?
questions.answer: Passing verdicts and maintaining law and order independently

questions.question: How did the British try to suppress the Quit India Movement?
questions.answer: Through police lathi charges, firing, and mass arrests

questions.question: What was Subhash Chandra Bose's view on India's role in WWII?
questions.answer: India should take advantage of Britain's difficulty and intensify the freedom struggle

questions.question: What was the 'Free India Centre' in Berlin?
questions.answer: An organization set up by Subhash Chandra Bose to coordinate the freedom struggle from abroad

questions.question: Which radio station did Netaji use to address Indians from Germany?
When was the Indian National Army formally handed over to Subhash Chandra Bose?
questions.answer: After he arrived in Southeast Asia in 1943

questions.question: What was the role of Captain Mohan Singh in the INA?
questions.answer: Helped Rash Behari Bose form the first INA battalion from POWs

questions.question: What was the Rani of Jhansi Regiment?
questions.answer: A women's regiment in the Indian National Army

questions.question: Which foreign power helped the INA logistically?
What happened to the INA after Japan's defeat in WWII?
questions.answer: Soldiers had to lay down their arms

questions.question: What was the public reaction to the INA trials?
questions.answer: Widespread anger and protests against the British

questions.question: What was the date of the Indian Naval Revolt?
Which other cities saw Air Force strikes in support of the Naval Revolt?
What was the British response to the Naval Revolt?
questions.answer: Sent army to open fire on naval soldiers

questions.question: How did common people support the 1946 revolts?
questions.answer: Workers and public extended support to rebelling soldiers

questions.question: Why was the Quit India Movement considered a mass uprising?
questions.answer: Because lakhs of ordinary people participated across the country

questions.question: What was the impact of the 1942 movement on British administration?
questions.answer: It disrupted transport, communication, and government machinery

questions.question: Who were some prominent young socialist leaders in the underground movement?
questions.answer: Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia, Achyutrao Patwardhan, Yusuf Meher Ali

questions.question: What was the significance of the Parallel Government in Satara?
questions.answer: It carried out administration, justice, and social reforms independently

questions.question: How did the British try to control the underground movement?
questions.answer: Through severe repression, arrests, and intelligence operations

questions.question: What was the main reason for the failure of the Cripps Mission?
questions.answer: Its proposals did not satisfy either the Congress or the Muslim League

questions.question: What was the main achievement of the INA's military campaign?
questions.answer: Capturing Aarakan province in Myanmar and posts in Assam

questions.question: Why were the INA trials politically significant?
questions.answer: They united Indian public opinion against British rule

questions.question: What was the ultimate impact of the 1942-46 struggles?
questions.answer: They made British rule unsustainable and accelerated independence

questions.question: Who were the 'Azad Hind Government' ministers under Netaji?
questions.answer: Shah Nawaz Khan, Prem Kumar Sehgal, Dr. Laxmi Swaminathan, etc.

questions.question: What was the slogan raised by school children in Nandurbar?
What was the fate of Hemu Kalani?
questions.answer: He was sentenced to death and hanged by the British
